reviews.review: Pyramid hot and flashbang go brrr

BIG EDIT: Well, Now that I believe the smoke has cleared from the controversy BHVR was in with the Hellraiser DLC, I think it's time to post my honest review of Dead by Daylight.

Dead by Daylight is an Asymmetrical Survival horror game where you go through trials with 4 survivors, and a Killer. The game varies depending on who you play as.

If you are survivor, you play from a 3rd person perspective, your job is to repair a total of 5 generators without getting caught, once you do that, its time for you to find the exit gate to open and make your escape, however if you get caught by the killer, you get taken to a meathook (Or killed in a sometimes awesome fashion) where you have to wait until your friends can come and get you down before you become the Entity's dinner.

If you are Killer, you play from a first person perspective, and your job is basically stop the survivors from doing the generators, and sacrifice (Or Kill them all with the Memento Mori addon) the survivors to win the game.

But I am going to be brutally honest with this game, even though I have a lot of play hours on this game, it has problems, and I mean BIG problems..

First the Good!

The things that I do like about the game the most is the Lore, the characters, and the Music. I believe these 3 things about dead by daylight are what BHVR does best. All of the survivors, even though many of them never speak a single word (Minus Ash from Evil Dead) are packed with lots of character, you can tell right away what their personality traits are through body language. We have a lot of the original characters like Dwight, Claudette, Kate, Feng and so on, but we also have a lot of licensed characters from other horror video games, like Leon and Jill from Resident Evil, Ash from Evil dead, and even Bill Overbeck from Left 4 Dead. I remember saying at one point that dead by Daylight is the Super Smash Bros of Horror, and that title still holds true and is one of the reasons I got into DBD to begin with.

The Lore is also fun to read whenever you get the chance to, The Entitys realm just seems so hopeless and depressing to be in, It's not quite Hell, but it might as well be. I truly feel sorry for the survivors and even the killers to a certain extent in their current situation, having to do these trials over and over without any chance actually leaving the realm and possibly defeating the Eldritch spider god that runs the show. However me and my friends like to roleplay as the characters and turn Dead by Daylight into a Horror comedy as part of our little headcanon.

The Music for the Killers is fantastic, I really hope that whoever does the music for the game gets a serious raise for their work. I listen to a lot of the killer chase music whenever I'm writing something horror related to get into the mood. My personal favorites are Pyramid head, Demogorgon, Oni, Twins and lastly Clown.


Now for the Bad, and the REALLY bad..


Gameplay:

The Gameplay, which should be the focal point of the development in DBD, is really unbalanced, and at worst is downright awful, Sometimes there's hits that shouldn't even be possible, there's invisible walls in the maps, and bugs, LOTS of them. For a live service game that is unacceptable, there should be times where BHVR should make updates that should be all about fixing bugs. I know that it isn't easy as Live service games need constant content updates, but if you want the game to be functional, you HAVE to address those bugs.

Community:

While Toxicity is common in all games regardless of genre or franchise, DBD has had a reputation of one of the most toxic gaming communities out there, during my time playing as survivor, you sometimes had teammates who never have your back, They only care about themselves and they through a hissy fit when they don't get their way, like disconnecting when they get caught or downed by the killer. 

However on the killer side, holy crap it gets really infuriating. I've had times where I played killer and the survivors gave me so much trouble that I almost was tempted to break my keyboard or Computer screen. The survivors can either Genrush you, Block you from doing anything, or just be a complete asshat and make your time miserable. But in the postgame chat, they can say really abusive, hurtful and outright offensive things towards you. It's during these times that you have to be the better person and just ignore what they say.

I think BHVR really should put their foot down on toxicity, there needs to be harsher punishments for disconnecting in matches, trolling the killer or their teammates, and just being an overall douchebag in game, this kind of attitude in DBD should not be tolerated, if I were in charge, Thwarting Toxicity would be one of the things I would do.


Hacking/Cheating

As of right now, I hear there has been a massive hacking problem the higher you rank up in the game, there are people who literally sabotage the entire game just to be jerks by hacking. Why do we have an Anti-cheat then huh? Does that mean anything? Hacking shouldn't even be happening in DBD, and yet it does, people still find ways to get around that. I think there should be measures put into place to stop this from happening, as hacking can really deter players from even wanting to boot up the game and play with friends.


So to sum it up, BHVR Fix your game. Please I am begging you to put some thought into making Dead by Daylight functional.

Overall, do I recommend this game? Well Yes and No. I'd say if you want to play, get some friends along and do it. It's always better to have people with you than to play by yourself. But beware of Toxicity, Hackers and bugs. 

After this whole NFT crisis, I still have my eye on you BHVR, I'm less willing to give them my money after they tricked us into contributing to that Hellraiser DLC. I hope they can win back my trust, if they pull that stunt again, I'm not coming back.


6 and a half/10

Играем короче в 4, попались против врачихи с топорами. Худо-бедно чиним генераторы, уже почти конец. Сначала эта курица ловит одного, сажает на крюк в одном конце карты, потом находит и ловит другого (меня) уже в противоположном. Оставшиеся 2 типа дочинивают свет и открывают ворота. Я им ору, что друзей кидают только крысы и они бегут нас спасать. Типа который спасал меня, тоже вешают на крюк, снимают меня двое оставшихся. Все вместе бежим спасать третьего, нас догоняет бабка и опускает двоих (третьего сняли). В итоге я хилю кореша и объясняю ему новый план спасения, как вдруг медсестра ставит ему с топора хэдшот.
Итого: все умирают, я убегаю, получаю новый ранг и меня кикают с пати. 8 крысиных хвостов из 10-ти.

P.S. бля я не знаю как эти ваши маньяки называются, баба кидает топоры, носит какие-то обноски и маску на голове
I hate this game and I love this game. I take a break from it, but then I get really bored and return. Anyway, just 1 moar game.

it's fun but at times can be a little annoying when matched up against a camper, someone who's REALLY good or just toxic people, they also do need to figure out some way to recognize the difference of "disconnection" and "abandonment" cause I have had two times where I crash/lag out of a game and it punishes me by timing me out for leaving a game i didn't want to leave. The matchmaking is also an issue, it should be more of endgame result or game play instead of MMR. Otherwise someone who just got curb stomped and put in a negative mood is thrown into a game they are doomed to fail. also, Legion seems to need a buff, it is very much nerfed to hell. But other than that the game is amazing and i do recommend you play! GL and HF in you do <3

I cannot, in good conscience, say i actually enjoy playing this game.

It is one of the single most buggiest games i have ever played. No matter how many 'bug fixes' they add to the game, it will always just cause another game-breaking bug.

Playing as survivor: Unless you want to wait 10 minutes to find a match or play with a bunch of braindead players against a rank 1 killer cause the game has poor matchmaking, don't. The game is extremely unfair to survivors, nerfing perks that used to be really good against killers and just making the killers OP. Only fun when playing with a full party

Playing as Killer: The only other way to have fun in DBD (Excluding Custom Matches). Playing as killer is a lot better fun wise, there aren't any bugs you'll have to worry about, there are no bad team mates and most of your perks are unfair to survivors. Though, half the time you're matched with toxic rank 1s.

The only reason you're playing this is because there are literally no other ('good'/active) games in this style.

In conclusion: Just play custom matches.
